content.title: Training in Silk
content.details: The 'Training in Silk' Component of the 'Development of Silk' Scheme by the Department of Industries and Commerce, Union Territory of Puducherry, aims to revamp the silk weaving industry and generate employment. It offers comprehensive one-year training to equip individuals with the necessary skills. The objective is to develop silk and silk-based industry, to train rural youth in silk weaving and to generate employment thereby.
benefits: Honorarium of ₹500 per trainee per month (up to ₹5000) for Master Trainer.
Compensation of ₹500 per trainee per month for raw materials (up to ₹5000) for Master Trainer.
eligibility: The age of the applicant should be between 18 and 35 years.
The applicant should be a native of Puducherry or a continuous resident of Puducherry for three years.
The applicant should not have already been trained before through this scheme.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. Step 1: The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form. Step 2: Fill in all mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all mandatory documents. Step 3: Visit the Project Manager, District Industries Centre, and submit the application form and documents. Step 4: A unique number is assigned to the applicant for identification.
documents_required: Any other document as required by the District Industries Centre.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided to trainees under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Trainees receive a monthly stipend of ₹1500 during the comprehensive one-year training period.

faqs.question: What compensation does the Master Trainer receive for each trainee per month?
faqs.answer: The Master Trainer receives an honorarium of ₹500 per trainee per month, along with ₹500 for raw materials.

faqs.question: Where is the Project Manager located for form submission?
faqs.answer: The Project Manager is located at District Industries Centre, Thattanchavady, Puducherry - 605 009.

faqs.question: What is the compensation for the Master Trainer's raw material expenses?
faqs.answer: The Master Trainer receives ₹500 per trainee per month for raw materials, up to a maximum of ₹5000.

faqs.question: Is there any age restriction for scheme applicants?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants should be between 18 and 35 years old to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can applicants from outside Puducherry apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants should either be natives of Puducherry or continuous residents for three years to be eligible.

faqs.question: What is the training duration for individuals under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The training duration is one year, aiming to equip individuals with the necessary skills for silk weaving.

faqs.question: How are applicants notified about the receipt of their application?
faqs.answer: Applicants receive acknowledgment through a unique identification number assigned upon receipt of the application.

faqs.question: What is the monthly stipend amount provided to trainees?
faqs.answer: Trainees receive a monthly stipend of ₹1500 during the comprehensive one-year training period.

faqs.question: Can applicants submit their forms on non-working days?
faqs.answer: No, applicants should submit their forms on working days during office hours.

faqs.question: What is the role of the District Industries Centre in the application process?
faqs.answer: The District Industries Centre is the designated location for applicants to submit their filled and signed application forms along with required documents.

faqs.question: How is the training component contributing to employment generation?
faqs.answer: By equipping individuals with silk weaving skills, the training component aims to generate employment opportunities within the silk industry.
